item.description: Thanks to Capt John Tadrzak of Misfits Audio for the bumper. Today we have the first part of a 3 part round table. Thanks to Capt John Tadrzak of Misfits Audio (http://misfitsaudio.com/) for the bumper.
Today we have the first part of a 3 part round table.
The participants for this first round table are: Julie Hoverson (http://www.19nocturneboulevard.com/) , Jack Ward (http://sonicsociety.org/) , and Fred Greenhalgh (http://www.radiodramarevival.com/)
Sorry the month of May went with no episodes, things should be getting better soon.
item.itunes:author: Audio Cinema Review

item.title: Episode 3: Zombies!
item.dc:creator: Chris
item.description: After taking the bulk of last month off, we are back with an interview and review! Thanks to Allen Sale of AstralAudio for the bumper! First Fred Greenhalgh joins me in the Podjector room, and we talk the article reviewing him in the Wall Street Journal. The article can be read on the Wall Street [...]
item.content:encoded:
After taking the bulk of last month off, we are back with an interview and review!

Thanks to Allen Sale of AstralAudio for the bumper!

First Fred Greenhalgh joins me in the Podjector room, and we talk the article reviewing him in the Wall Street Journal.  The  article can be read on the Wall Street Journal here.

In News, the one and only Roger Ebert (@EbertChicago on Twitter) seems to listen to Decoder Ring Theatre’s shows, with his tweet:

Decoder ring theater. The Masked Marvel is standing by. http://j.mp/97B8AP

For our review this episode, we have a look at KC Wayland’s We’re Alive. A “Zombie” Story of Survival. You can find it online at http://www.zombiepodcast.com or on iTunes. Also check out the interview that Fred did with the producers over at: Radio Drama Revival #167.
item.itunes:keywords: Adventures of the Red Panda,Fred from Radio Drama Revival,Zombie
item.itunes:subtitle: After taking the bulk of last month off, we are back with an interview and review! - Thanks to Allen Sale of AstralAudio for the bumper! - First Fred Greenhalgh joins me in the Podjector room, and we talk the article reviewing him in the Wall Street Jo...
item.itunes:summary:
After taking the bulk of last month off, we are back with an interview and review!
Thanks to Allen Sale of AstralAudio (http://www.astralaudio.net/) for the bumper!
First Fred Greenhalgh joins me in the Podjector room, and we talk the article reviewing him in the Wall Street Journal.Â TheÂ article can be read on the Wall Street Journal here. (http://online.wsj.com/article/SB10001424052748704240004575085313479028540.html?mod=WSJ_LifeStyle_Lifestyle_5#)
In News, the one and only Roger Ebert (@EbertChicago (http://twitter.com/ebertchicago) on Twitter) seems to listen to Decoder Ring Theatre's shows, with his tweet (http://twitter.com/ebertchicago/statuses/11091877298): Decoder ring theater. The Masked Marvel is standing by. http://j.mp/97B8AP (http://j.mp/97B8AP) For our review this episode, we have a look at KC Wayland's We're Alive. A "Zombie" Story of Survival. You can find it online at http://www.zombiepodcast.com (http://www.zombiepodcast.com) or on iTunes (http://itunes.apple.com/us/podcast/were-alive-a-zombie-story/id313300476). Also check out the interview that Fred did with the producers over at: Radio Drama Revival #167 (http://www.radiodramarevival.com/episode-167-zombies-return-for-war-creators-of-were-alive-chat/).
item.itunes:author: Audio Cinema Review

item.title: CONvergence 2009: State of the Audio
item.dc:creator: Chris
item.description: Recently Jeff Adams of Ice Box Theatre, asked me if I would be interested in playing some sessions he was on in CONvergence 2009 about audio drama. Here is the first of 3: State of the Audio.
item.content:encoded: Recently Jeff Adams of Ice Box Theatre, asked me if I would be interested in playing some sessions he was on in CONvergence 2009 about audio drama. Here is the first of 3: State of the Audio.

item.title: Episode 2: Something Special
item.dc:creator: Chris
item.description: Bumper and promo for this episode is from Paul Cooley’s new audio book Closet Treats. News: Julie Hoverson from 19 Nocturne Blvd reported that Voices In The Wind Audio Theatre (currently producing “Running to Detroit”) has commissioned and accepted a script from her, titled “The House on Mulberry Hill”, for production as their Halloween presentation! [...]
item.content:encoded:
Bumper and promo for this episode is from Paul Cooley’s new audio book Closet Treats.

News:

Julie Hoverson from 19 Nocturne Blvd reported that Voices In The Wind Audio Theatre (currently producing “Running to Detroit”) has commissioned and accepted a script from her, titled “The House on Mulberry Hill”, for production as their Halloween presentation!

Reviews:

Fred from Audio Drama Revival reviews Tesla vs the USA.

I review the streaming service provided by Ice Box Radio.

Special:

I release my work in progress series Harvey Klaxon: Problem Specialist via Creative Commons Attribution-Share Alike 3.0 United States License. you can get a copy of the first 3 scripts I wrote by clicking here.

I also play what was to be episode 2: Loss, which had the following cast:

Cast of Characters

Kelly: Vanessa Hart

Harvey: Paul Campbell

Admiral Kutz: Dani Cutler

DOCTOR WOLF: Jack Hosely

Computer: April Sadowski

Music credit:

By Candlelight by Permanent 4

Sad Movie by David Cyr

Intro and outro music is:

A Synthesis of Logic by Beatnik Turtle
item.itunes:keywords: 19 Nocturne Blvd,Fred from Radio Drama Revival,Ice Box Radio
item.itunes:subtitle: Bumper and promo for this episode is from Paul Cooley's new audio book Closet Treats. - News: - Julie Hoverson from 19 Nocturne Blvd reported that Voices In The Wind Audio Theatre (currently producing "Running to Detroit") has commissioned and accepted...
item.itunes:summary:
Bumper and promo for this episode is from Paul Cooley's new audio book Closet Treats (http://shadowpublications.com/?q=node/144).
News:
Julie Hoverson from 19 Nocturne Blvd reported that Voices In The Wind Audio Theatre (currently producing "Running to Detroit") has commissioned and accepted a script from her, titled "The House on Mulberry Hill", for production as their Halloween presentation!
Reviews:
Fred from Audio Drama Revival reviews Tesla vs the USA (http://www.noirdame.com/blog/Tesla).
I review the streaming service provided by Ice Box Radio (http://iceboxradio.org/Home.html).
Special:
I release my work in progress series Harvey Klaxon: Problem Specialist via Creative Commons Attribution-Share Alike 3.0 United States License. you can get a copy of the first 3 scripts I wrote by clicking here. (http://media.audiocinemareview.com/HarveyKlaxon.zip)
I also play what was to be episode 2: Loss, which had the following cast:
Cast of Characters Kelly: Vanessa Hart Harvey: Paul Campbell Admiral Kutz: Dani Cutler DOCTOR WOLF: Jack Hosely Computer: April Sadowski Music credit: By Candlelight (http://music.podshow.com/music/listeners/artistdetails.php?BandHash=39bb00c5b6112868e0e04769344724c0)by Permanent 4 (http://music.podshow.com/music/listeners/artistdetails.php?BandHash=39bb00c5b6112868e0e04769344724c0) (http://music.podshow.com/music/listeners/artistdetails.php?BandHash=ecb762fcc6646f77c19469f8871a5dc6) Sad Movie (http://music.podshow.com/music/listeners/artistdetails.php?BandHash=ecb762fcc6646f77c19469f8871a5dc6)by David Cyr (http://music.podshow.com/music/listeners/artistdetails.php?BandHash=ecb762fcc6646f77c19469f8871a5dc6) Intro and outro music is: A Synthesis of Logic (http://thesongoftheday.com/) by Beatnik Turtle (http://thesongoftheday.com/)
item.itunes:author: Audio Cinema Review

item.title: Episode 1: Review of The Adventures of The Red Panda
item.dc:creator: Chris
item.description: Special thanks to Indiana Jim for the doing my episode 1 bumper. In News: There is now a rating system for your Audio Drama like you will find on your TV shows and Movies. You can find full details about it at the Audio Drama Directory. February is now Script Writing Month. Find more information [...]
item.content:encoded:
Special thanks to Indiana Jim for the doing my episode 1 bumper.

In News:

There is now a rating system for your Audio Drama like you will find on your TV shows and Movies. You can find full details about it at the Audio Drama Directory.

February is now Script Writing Month. Find more information at Audio Drama Talk.

Review:

For our first review, I review The Adventures of The Red Panda. Listen to the episode, for the review.

Rating:
item.itunes:subtitle: Special thanks to Indiana Jim for the doing my episode 1 bumper. - In News: - There is now a rating system for your Audio Drama like you will find on your TV shows and Movies. You can find full details about it at the Audio Drama Directory.
item.itunes:summary:
Special thanks to Indiana Jim (http://podcast.indianajim.net/) for the doing my episode 1 bumper.
In News:
There is now a rating system for your Audio Drama like you will find on your TV shows and Movies. You can find full details about it at the Audio Drama Directory (http://audiodramadirectory.com/ratings/).
February is now Script Writing Month. Find more information at Audio Drama Talk. (http://www.audiodramatalk.com/f19-writers-room/12-tips-be-super-prolific-audio-drama-writer-5233.html)
Review:
For our first review, I review The Adventures of The Red Panda (http://www.decoderringtheatre.com/redpanda/). Listen to the episode, for the review.
Rating: (http://audiocinemareview.com/images/5podjectors.png)
item.itunes:author: Audio Cinema Review

item.title: Episode -1: Rustycon Panel 1
item.dc:creator: Chris
item.description: Julie Hoverson hostess of 19 Nocturne Boulevard recently released a bonus blog of a panel she was on at Rustycon. This is the panel that made me decide to finally start this podcast. No talking from me in this episode, look for episode 0 soon. [UPDATE: Due to the complaints that Julie received about this [...]
item.content:encoded:
Julie Hoverson hostess of 19 Nocturne Boulevard recently released a bonus blog of a panel she was on at Rustycon. This is the panel that made me decide to finally start this podcast.

No talking from me in this episode, look for episode 0 soon.

[UPDATE: Due to the complaints that Julie received about this piece she has asked that it be removed, as she has done from her own feed. For full details as to what happened, please check out: the Audio Drama Talk board.]
